citation.article-title: Calidifontibacter indicus gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the family Dermacoccaceae isolated from a hot spring, and emended description of the family Dermacoccaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the family Dermacoccaceae
Dermacoccaceae (Der.ma.coc.ca′ce.ae. N.L. masc. n Dermacoccus type genus of the family; -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Dermacoccaceae the Dermacoccus family).
The family contains the type genus Dermacoccus (Stackebrandt et al., 1995) and the genera Kytococcus (Stackebrandt et al., 1995), Demetria (Groth et al., 1997) and Calidifontibacter (this study).
Besides the characteristics mentioned above, members of the family are capable of growing on 2–10 % NaCl.
Do not hydrolyse Tween 20 or Tween 40.
Most species are sensitive to streptomycin, polymyxin B and gentamicin.

Negative for the oxidation of the following sugars in Biolog GP2 MicroPlates: α-cyclodextrin, β-cyclodextrin, glycogen, inulin, mannan, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, N-acetyl-β-d-mannosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, d-fructose, m-inositol, α-lactose, lactulose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, methyl α-d-galactoside, methyl β-d-galactoside, 3-methyl-d-glucose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl β-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, palatinose, d-psicose, salicin, d-sorbitol, stachyose, d-tagatose, AMP, UMP, d-fructose 6-phosphate, α-d-glucose 1-phosphate and d-glucose 6-phosphate.
The major fatty acids include iso-C16 : 0, iso-C16 : 0 H and anteiso-C17 : 0.
The peptidoglycan structure is of the A4α pattern with the linkage Lys–Gly–Ser–Asp.
The common polar lipids are DPG, PG and PI; in addition, PIM and PS are also present.
